basics.name: Adrien Gibert
basics.label: Full Stack Developer - 6+ years of experience
basics.summary: Within my 7 years of professional experience, I have gained knowledge in 3 different aspects of IT: Front-End Development, Back-End Development, and Automated Quality Assurance Testing. I am primarily a JavaScript programmer; I have had to write Java and Python functionality but I am not proficient.

highlights: Involved in developing components of single page applications Vue.js
Implemented emergency caching strategy for REST-API using Elastcache Redis to store multiple data calls using a combination “key”, “field”, and “value” pairs
Responsible for developing automated unit, integration, and performance test suites
Created an API layer on a legacy application by modifying Apache Solr configuration and creating Python 3 scripts
Create and maintain AWS infrastructure such as EC2 servers, Security Groups, Lambda functions, and S3 buckets
Regularly update application dependencies, such as application packages and AWS machine images, and modify code based on cyber recommendations
Rebuild API application to remove an external dependency of a deprecated internal module
Create PagerDuty alerts from Splunk and DataDog application data to identify incidents quickly and mitigate consumer impact
Perform quarterly AWS regional failover exercises for 3 applications
work.summary: I was hired as a contractor to help the developed of the new UI and API for the disclosures, articles, task guides, etc. used by call center agents and other associates in Capital One.

highlights: Trained in the basics of the MongoDB, Express, React, AngularJS & Angular 2+, and Node.js
Used Firebase Real Time database to receive data from POST, PUT, DELETE, and GET API calls
Mock interviews given every week to ensure knowledge of basic Front–End vernacular
Created a “Social media” SPA as the final project to represent an overall understanding of the programming principles taught
work.summary: I am managed by this company for my contract with Capital One. They provide developers with training before being sent to work on projects.

highlights: Helped develop UI automation test suite for multiple platforms using Jasmine and WebDriverIO
Performed manual testing for tickets (development, defects, etc) in their respective sprint
Regularly run automation suite to check stability of the platform
Perform regression testing for monthly releases to ensure application stability after deployment
work.summary: I was hired to develop an automated test script and perform manual testing to remove an outsourced contract on regression testing.

highlights: Create documentation of Carter’s applications for store iPod devices to enhance customer experience
Push applications to over 600 stores using the AirWatch Console
Troubleshoot store iPod device tickets dealing with the applications and connectivity issues
Actively developed VBA program in Excel resulting in improved daily operation
Created a VBA function to control user pasting that was implemented in tools currently used
work.summary: I experinecd both Level 3 Support for store associates and was tasked to develop an application in Excel to generate styles.

volunteer.summary: Through the YearUp program, I volunteered to be a mentor to students working on business applications. Afterwards, I was offered the opportunity to teach an after-school IT class.
highlights: Mentored the DYF students phases of the SDLC towards a project they were trying to create and developing their presentation skills of a business concept
Taught an after-school class on Scratch and Code.org to 3rd-5th grade students

skills.name: Back End Tech
keywords: JS Frameworks: Node.js, Fastify, Express, Next.js
